[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/traits.rs] [Trait: ToOnChainGasSchedule, Method: to_on_chain_gas_schedule()] [Key name collisions] Can implementations from different gas parameter modules generate overlapping String key names in the output Vec, causing one set of parameters to silently overwrite another during on-chain storage? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/traits.rs] [Trait: ToOnChainGasSchedule, Method: to_on_chain_gas_schedule()] [Empty output validation] If an implementation returns an empty Vec<(String, u64)>, representing zero gas parameters, how is this handled by the on-chain storage layer, and can it cause the gas schedule to be deleted or corrupted? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/traits.rs] [Trait: ToOnChainGasSchedule, Method: to_on_chain_gas_schedule()] [Key ordering dependency] Does the trait specification require any specific ordering of entries in the output Vec, and if implementations produce different orderings, can this cause hash-based state commitments to differ across validators? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/traits.rs] [Trait: ToOnChainGasSchedule, Method: to_on_chain_gas_schedule()] [String allocation attacks] Can implementations that generate String keys dynamically be exploited to cause excessive memory allocations or heap fragmentation during serialization, degrading validator performance? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/traits.rs] [Trait: ToOnChainGasSchedule, Method: to_on_chain_gas_schedule()] [Feature version backdating] Can an attacker serialize a gas schedule with an artificially low feature_version to make newer, validated parameters appear as legacy parameters, bypassing modern safety checks? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/traits.rs] [Trait: ToOnChainGasSchedule, Method: to_on_chain_gas_schedule()] [Concurrent serialization safety] If multiple threads call this method concurrently on shared gas parameter instances, are implementations required to be thread-safe, or can race conditions corrupt the output Vec? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/traits.rs] [Trait: ToOnChainGasSchedule, Method: to_on_chain_gas_schedule()] [Asymmetric round-trip] If serialization via to_on_chain_gas_schedule() followed by deserialization via from_on_chain_gas_schedule() doesn't produce identical gas parameters, can this asymmetry be exploited to gradually corrupt the gas schedule across governance updates?
